Q_DESC:
Computing BMI) Body Mass Index (BMI) is a measure of health on weight. It can be calculated by taking your weight in kilograms and dividing by the square of your height in meters. Write a program that prompts the user to enter a weight in pounds and height in inches and displays the BMI. 

Note that one pound is 0.45359237 kilograms and one inch is 0.0254 meters

The first input corresponds to height in meters (float data type) and second input refers to weight (integer)

Use Double Data Type to calculate the BMI index as follows: 

bmi = weight/(height*height)

Round the final value to 2 decimal points as follows = String.format( %.2f, outputValue)
